intro: Pilosella winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler's pearly everlet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a delicate appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is native to parts of southern Africa. Its leaves are usually hairy and grayish-green, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pilosella winkleri is often found in open, sunny habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
